page.title: 15VICTORIAN COUNTRY HOUSE
page.content: After school we visited Elbrook House. The House was built by The Fordhams (who lived at the Bury) for their son when he married in 1870. It was eventually sold out of the family. It has changed hands twice since the Second World War. The present owners moved in in 1962. The mother of the owner of Bluegates who we interviewed lived there before she married. There has been a great deal of interior conversion. The kitchen has been moved nearer to the dining room. This is interesting because when the house was built servants would have waited at table. In modern times even people in large houses cannot afford servants. Large houses are sometimes divided up into flats. There were two flats here but now there is only the one in what used to be the servants quarters.
